intro: Verbesina hookeri, commonly known as the Hooker's beggar-ticks, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, and its flowers are typically arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. It thrives in moist, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and wetlands. Verbesina hookeri is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
